trans-unit.source: Debug and analyze Hadoop services with heap dumps | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Debug and analyze Hadoop services with heap dumps | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Automatically collect heap dumps for Hadoop services and place inside the Azure Blob storage account for debugging and analysis.
trans-unit.target: Automatically collect heap dumps for Hadoop services and place inside the Azure Blob storage account for debugging and analysis.

trans-unit.source: Heap dumps can be automatically collected for Hadoop services and placed inside the Azure Blob storage account of a user under HDInsightHeapDumps/.
trans-unit.target: Heap dumps can be automatically collected for Hadoop services and placed inside the Azure Blob storage account of a user under HDInsightHeapDumps/.

trans-unit.source: Dump files for a service with heaps contain a snapshot of the application's memory.
trans-unit.target: Dump files for a service with heaps contain a snapshot of the application's memory.

trans-unit.source: This includes the values of variables at the time the dump was created.
trans-unit.target: This includes the values of variables at the time the dump was created.

trans-unit.source: The collection of heap dumps for various services must be enabled for services on individual clusters.
trans-unit.target: The collection of heap dumps for various services must be enabled for services on individual clusters.

trans-unit.source: The default for this feature is to be off for a cluster.
trans-unit.target: The default for this feature is to be off for a cluster.

trans-unit.source: These heap dumps can be large, so it is advisable to monitor the Blob storage account where they are being saved once the collection has been enabled.
trans-unit.target: These heap dumps can be large, so it is advisable to monitor the Blob storage account where they are being saved once the collection has been enabled.

trans-unit.source: The information in this article only applies to Windows-based HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: The information in this article only applies to Windows-based HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: For information on Linux-based HDInsight, see <linkText>Enable heap dumps for Hadoop services on Linux-based HDInsight</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For information on Linux-based HDInsight, see <linkText>Enable heap dumps for Hadoop services on Linux-based HDInsight</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The services that can have heap dumps enabled if requested are:
trans-unit.target: The services that can have heap dumps enabled if requested are:

trans-unit.source: hcatalog - tempelton
trans-unit.target: hcatalog - tempelton

trans-unit.source: hive - hiveserver2, metastore, derbyserver
trans-unit.target: hive - hiveserver2, metastore, derbyserver

trans-unit.source: mapreduce - jobhistoryserver
trans-unit.target: mapreduce - jobhistoryserver

trans-unit.source: yarn - resourcemanager, nodemanager, timelineserver
trans-unit.target: yarn - resourcemanager, nodemanager, timelineserver

trans-unit.source: hdfs - datanode, secondarynamenode, namenode
trans-unit.target: hdfs - datanode, secondarynamenode, namenode

trans-unit.source: To turn on heap dumps for a service, you need to set the appropriate configuration elements in the section for that service, which is specified by service_name.
trans-unit.target: To turn on heap dumps for a service, you need to set the appropriate configuration elements in the section for that service, which is specified by service_name.

trans-unit.source: The value of service_name can be any of the services listed above: tempelton, hiveserver2, metastore, derbyserver, jobhistoryserver, resourcemanager, nodemanager, timelineserver, datanode, secondarynamenode, or namenode.
trans-unit.target: The value of service_name can be any of the services listed above: tempelton, hiveserver2, metastore, derbyserver, jobhistoryserver, resourcemanager, nodemanager, timelineserver, datanode, secondarynamenode, or namenode.
